p: S. sobrinus 6715 was grown for 20 h at 37 °C in 4 L of Todd Hewitt broth. After centrifugation of the culture at 1300 g for 10 min at 4 °C, the cells were collected and then extracted with 8 M urea for 1 h with stirring. The crude enzyme solution containing urea was dialyzed against 10 mM sodium phosphate buffer (pH 6) until the urea was removed entirely. One milliliter of the crude enzyme solution was pipetted into a microtube and stored in a freezer at − 80 °C [ 30].
